text:
There’s a really useful hubspot template for generating ideas like this. I’ll see if I can dig it out. Last time we did it worked pretty well in minimal amount of time in that we split into two groups , each with a spreadsheet to complete of ideas, chucked down as many ideas as we could then swapped sheets half way to see if they’d prompt any more. 

Interesting suggestion from hubspot was to iterate on existing ideas. So if someone suggests ‘how to make widgets’ you can then diversify into how to make blue widgets, how to make red widgets, how to make widgets for doctors, etc. 

Obvious but useful to have as an active option in a brainstorm if people aren’t used to coming up with lots of ideas. 

Then after the event the content team of two decide which ones have SEO potential and which ones are the bofu ones.

Interesting suggestion from hubspot was to iterate on existing ideas. So if someone suggests ‘how to make widgets’ you can then diversify into how to make blue widgets, how to make red widgets, how to make widgets for doctors, etc. 

Obvious but useful to have as an active option in a brainstorm if people aren’t used to coming up with lots of ideas.

text: <@U015BEETZ2P> this sounds tough! I have been in similar situations. It sounds like it might be worth trying to proactively assign topics instead of patching the problem after it’s written. Maybe you have a 20 min conversation with each contributor so you can get to know them and develop assignments that work for their interest area and your overall content strategy.

elements.text: this sounds tough! I have been in similar situations. It sounds like it might be worth trying to proactively assign topics instead of patching the problem after it’s written. text: Like many, I lean toward building great content. Myself and clients. And then developing a distribution (and redistribution) strategy. I know (because my clients are doing well with organic search) it starts to pay off in time even without a ton of links. I have recently started testing with RhinoRank but haven't had the budget to put toward an order that could make a difference. I really just use it as supplemental. I look at broken link building as it's not terrible; I mean the person has a broken link. It needs fixed right? And HARO. I also agree with the rest about not spending time on comment link building.
